security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing no executable code. All flagged patterns are false positives from code examples and documentation text. The skill provides legitimate security guidance for npm dependency scanning, SBOM generation, and supply chain security best practices.

content.user_title: Scan dependencies for vulnerabilities and generate SBOM
content.value_statement: Dependency vulnerabilities are a leading cause of security breaches in modern applications. This skill provides clear guidance for scanning npm packages, generating Software Bill of Materials documents, and implementing supply chain security practices.
actual_capabilities: Run npm audit to detect critical and high severity vulnerabilities in project dependencies
Generate SBOM documents using CycloneDX or SPDX formats for compliance and transparency
Configure .npmrc security settings to prevent malicious script execution during installation
Integrate security checks into CI/CD pipelines using GitHub Actions or similar platforms
Check for deprecated packages and outdated dependencies that may contain security flaws
Verify package integrity using lockfiles and npm ci for reproducible builds
limitations: Does not automatically fix vulnerabilities - requires manual review and intervention for each issue
Limited to Node.js and npm ecosystem - does not cover Python, Ruby, Java or other package managers
Does not scan system-level dependencies or native binary packages outside npm registry
Security scanner effectiveness depends on npm registry vulnerability database completeness

output_examples.input: Run npm audit and check for vulnerabilities
output: Found 2 moderate vulnerabilities (can be deferred to next sprint)
Recommendation: Run npm audit fix to apply automatic patches, then run tests to verify compatibility
Included version, license, and package URL for each dependency
Saved to sbom.json (ready for submission to compliance team)
Created .npmrc with ignore-scripts=true to prevent pre-install script execution
Enabled strict-ssl=true to enforce secure registry connections
Pinned registry to https://registry.npmjs.org/ to prevent registry hijacking
Security hardening complete - safe to run npm install

best_practices: Always commit package-lock.json to ensure reproducible builds and prevent supply chain attacks
Set ignore-scripts=true in .npmrc to prevent malicious pre-install and post-install script execution
Generate SBOM documents regularly and store them as release artifacts for compliance and transparency
anti_patterns: Using npm install instead of npm ci in CI pipelines - may install different versions than lockfile specifies
Ignoring moderate severity vulnerabilities without documenting decision and tracking for future resolution
Adding packages without checking maintenance status, download counts, or reviewing recent security advisories

faq.question: Does this skill work with yarn or pnpm package managers?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on npm commands. For yarn, use yarn audit. For pnpm, use pnpm audit with similar syntax.

faq.question: What severity level should block production builds?
faq.answer: Block on critical and high severity issues. Track moderate issues for resolution. Low severity can be deferred to regular updates.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with GitHub Actions or GitLab CI?
faq.answer: Yes. Add a step that runs npm audit --audit-level=high and exits with failure code if vulnerabilities are found.

faq.question: Does this skill send data to external services?
faq.answer: The skill provides guidance only. Commands like npm audit make read-only API calls to the npm registry vulnerability database.

faq.question: What if npm audit returns no results or errors?
faq.answer: This can indicate an outdated npm version or network issues. Update npm to the latest version and verify registry connectivity.

faq.question: How does this compare to Snyk, WhiteSource, or commercial scanners?
faq.answer: npm audit uses the npm registry database for free. Commercial tools have larger databases, better reporting, and advanced features but require setup.
